SEARCH
Package com.app.txt.transfer

Interface Transfer<T,U>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the key in the map used for reading and writing
U - the type of the value in the map used for reading
All Known Implementing Classes:
TransferImpl
public interface Transfer<T,U>
Interface for transferring data between files and objects.

This interface defines methods for reading data from a file and writing data to a file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Map<T,U>
    read(String filename, LineParser<T,U> lineParser)
    Reads data from a file and parses it into a map.
    void
    write(String filename, T t, Function<T,String> prepare)
    Writes data to a file.

  • Method Details

    • read

      Map<T,U> read(String filename, LineParser<T,U> lineParser)
      Reads data from a file and parses it into a map.

      Each line of the file is processed using the provided LineParser, which parses each line into a key-value pair. The resulting map contains the data read from the file.

      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to read from
      lineParser - a LineParser used to parse each line into a map entry
      Returns:
      a map containing the data read from the file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if filename or lineParser is null or empty
      RuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs during reading

    • write

      void write(String filename, T t, Function<T,String> prepare)
      Writes data to a file.

      The object t is converted to a string using the provided Function, and the resulting string is written to the specified file.

      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to write to
      t - the object to be written to the file
      prepare - a Function that converts the object to a string for writing
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if filename, t, or prepare is null
      RuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs during writing
